intro: Onobrychis caput-galli var. tripolitana, commonly known as the Tripolitan crown vetch, is a perennial legume native to North Africa. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a robust root system that helps prevent soil erosion. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in reclamation projects. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it beneficial for soil fertility.
